main event: A pilot of a C-121 aircraft observed a bright white object moving at high speed over Newfoundland, Canada.
interesting points: The object was the size of a baseball held at arm's length and traveled from 138 degrees to directly overhead the aircraft.
The object dissipated in a shower of red sparks with no trail or exhaust seen.
The pilot, with 15 years of experience, estimated the object's altitude at the time of dissipation to be between 15,322-15,920 feet.
A check with radar sites in the area and the Naval Air Station at Argentia failed to confirm the sighting.
The cockpit of the aircraft was brilliantly illuminated for 15-23 seconds by a white light described as intense as an arc welding torch.
sighted object: a round white object the size of a baseball held at arm's length
location: 60 miles due west of Argentia, Newfoundland, Canada
witnesses: pilot and co-pilot of a C-121 aircraft
photographs: no photographs included in the report
